channel.description: The Sci-Fi and Fantasy Geek is about science fiction and fantasy TV series, SCIFI and Fantasy genre movies, news and articles, high tech toys, and gizmos. I might even do a book review. You can reach me at Voicemail Number: 206-666-6218 or thescifigeek@gmail.com This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com

item.title: 018 - News, News, News
item.author: SirGeorge@sirgeorge.us
item.description: The Sci-Fi and Fantasy Geek: Tonight podcast is full of news and DVD releases. There are two DVD that I just can not wait for them to be released. The 1st one I can not want till it is out: Futurama: The Beast with a Billion Backs on DVD this June 24th. The 2nd DVD I had know idea this was even in the makes, I was just doing some research on a up coming podcast I plain to do and found this: Starship Troopers 3: Marauder release date of July 15, 2008. What is so great about Starship Troopers 3 is that Johnny Rico is back and played by Casper Van Dien and Jolene Blalock (T'Pol from Star Trek: Enterprise) who plays Captain Lola Beck, the movie looks good here is the link to the movie trailer on youtube http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t7DTy_5ijV0 http://thescifigeek.blogspot.com Promos played: Remember The 80s, SciFi Surplus, Geek By Night, and Treks in Sci-Fi

item.title: 017 - Ten Bad Tech Ads
item.author: SirGeorge@sirgeorge.us
item.description: The Sci-Fi and Fantasy Geek - Ten Bad Tech Ads: The tech industry has a rich and hilarious history of being unable to promote itself as anything other than unutterably dorky. Originally I was going to call this 'The top ten worst tech ads', but as I hunted around and discovered these are pure gold. They are shockingly bad, but you'll derive so much pleasure from watching them it didn't seem right to use 'worst' anymore. Anyway, I've collected ten of my favorites -- in no particular order -- that made my laugh, either because they feature lyrics, awful singing, pathetic old technology, Steve Ballmer or some combination of all of the above. To watch videos I played tonight go to - http://thescifigeek.blogspot.com Promos played: Remember The 80s, Geek By Night, and Treks in Sci-Fi

item.itunes:subtitle: 017 - Ten Bad Tech Ads

item.title: 016 - Geeking Radio Wednesdays
item.author: SirGeorge@sirgeorge.us
item.description:
The Sci-Fi and Fantasy Geek: It is Wednesday you know what that means! Its Geeking Radio Wednesday... This week of songs are not that great but you might find one that you like. Songs played on the show: Dennis the Phantom Menace by 10,000 Lakes, She Wants an American Girl by Power Salad, The Contraceptive March by C4C, The Tourist Rap (The Sequel) by DJ Particle, and Vampire Surprise by Veronique Chevalier.
Promos played TREKS in SCI-FI, Geek By Night and Remember the 80s
http://thescifigeek.blogspot.com

item.title: 009 - The Sci-Fi and Fantasy Geek - 50 Widgets For Your Blog
item.author: SirGeorge@sirgeorge.us
item.description:
The Sci-Fi and Fantasy Geek - 50 Widgets For Your Blog: Widgets are a handy, easy and simple way to add some flare to your blog. Whether youd like to display the number of currently online visitors to your site or simply the weather report for Los Angeles, you can do it with widgets. Ive assembled a list of 50 useful or simply cool widgets for your pleasure. You can find all links at http://thescifigeek.blogspot.com/
All music is podsafe: Joe Sibol - Hot Sexy Girls Bayview Mix, D5L - This Life, D5L - Just For You and ubzorb - taptrancing shoes
